data.tweet: See the numbers behind Manchester Utd's away victory ⚽️ 🧵 👇
sentences: Manchester Utd won 0 - 1.

data.tweet: Manchester Utd carried the ball into the opponent's box seven times, while Leicester City did so twice. United also completed seven successful dribbles, while Leicester only managed three.
sentences: Manchester Utd carried the ball into the opponent's box seven times.
Leicester City carried the ball into the opponent's box twice.
Manchester Utd dribbled past an opponent seven times.
Leicester City dribbled past an opponent three times.

data.tweet: Man Utd also completed four passes into Leicester's box, considerably less than the 8.6 average for Premier League teams this season.
sentences: Manchester Utd played four successful balls into the opponent's box.
Premier League teams have averaged 8.6 passes into the opponent's box per 90 minutes.
story: Passes into the penalty area (league average)

data.tweet: Man Utd were energic off the ball, pressing 67 times in the middle third, compared with 37 times in their last game (against Southampton).
sentences: Manchester Utd pressed their opponent 67 times in the middle third.
In their last game (against Southampton) Manchester Utd pressed their opponent 37 times in the middle third.
story: Middle third presses (in last match v Southampton)

data.tweet: Manchester Utd made 10 clearances in this match, considerably less than the 40 they made in their last match (against Southampton). This season Manchester Utd have averaged 26.0 clearances per 90 minutes.
sentences: Manchester Utd made 10 clearances.
In their last game (against Southampton) Manchester Utd made 40 clearances.
This season, Manchester Utd have made an average of 26 clearances per 90 minutes.
Premier League teams have cleared the ball an average of 22 times per 90 minutes.

data.tweet: Marcus Rashford, our man of the match, created some of the best chances of the game - tallying 0.8 expected assists (more than anyone else on the pitch).
sentences: Marcus Rashford was our man of the match.
Marcus Rashford managed to create 0.8 xA worth of chances.
Marcus Rashford created more expected goals than any other player on the pitch.

data.tweet: Marcus Rashford played three successful passes into the opponent's box and recieved 14 progressive passes (both more than any other player on the pitch).
sentences: Marcus Rashford managed to play an impressive 3 successful balls into the opponent's box.
Marcus Rashford managed to play more successful balls into the box than anyone else on the pitch.
Marcus Rashford successfully recieved 14 progressive passes.
Marcus Rashford successfully recieved more progressive passes than any other player on the pitch.
